701755f-b.text:
Schurz Avenue, south side, at the foot of Brinsmade Avenue (near the shore of the East River), showing the Havemeyer Mansion as it looked after it was remodeled by Collis P. Huntington, the railroad magnate, who later bought the house. During the American Revolution the British, under General Howe, landed here on October 12, 1778 for their attack on Westchester. The G. W. Bromley map of 1927 shows the Mansion to be occupied by the Sisters of the Divine Compassion.
1906
Gift of Randall Comfort
701755f-b.folder: Schurz Avenue & Brinsmade Avenue, Bronx, NY
